column1: We’re looking for the next generation of Client Service Representatives - those with a passion for growing a long-term career
column2: building relationships and working with a team of client professionals in one of our Consumer Client Services centers. The Client Service Representative role is meant for those looking to make a real impact and build a career in financial services. Client Service Representatives (CSR) have a passion for delivering a personalized and caring experience – they anticipate and resolve client concerns with the goal of exceeding expectations

we’re guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better by connecting clients and communities to the resources they need to be successful. Every day we provide unmatched convenience by serving approximately 66 million consumer and small business clients. At Bank of America

column1: As part of the Bank of America team

Specialists are sales professionals who work in a call center and understand that being there for our clients is our number one priority. What would you like the power to do?

column1: Robert Half Technology is seeking PC/Computer Technician candidates for our Phoenix-based clients! A successful IT Technician must have a thorough knowledge of computer software and hardware and a variety of internet applications
column2: networks and operating systems. The ideal candidate will also have great troubleshooting abilities and attention to detail.

column1: Other essential functions of this position include:
•      Set up workstations with computers and necessary peripheral devices (routers
•      Install and configure appropriate software and functions according to specifications
•      Develop and maintain local networks in ways that optimize performance
•      Ensure security and privacy of networks and computer systems
•      Provide orientation and guidance to users on how to operate new software and computer equipment
•      Organize and schedule upgrades and maintenance without deterring others from completing their work
•      Perform troubleshooting to diagnose and resolve problems (repair or replace parts
•      Maintain records/logs of repairs and fixes and maintenance schedule
•      Identify computer or network equipment shortages and place orders
Some of the position's requirements include:
•      Proven experience as IT Technician or relevant position
•      In depth understanding of diverse computer systems and networks
•      Good knowledge of internet security and data privacy principles
•      Certification as IT Technician will be an advantage (e.g. CompTIA A+

we’re guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better by connecting clients and communities to the resources they need to be successful. Every day we provide unmatched convenience by serving approximately 66 million consumer and small business clients. At Bank of America
column3: we strive to be a bank for everyone. Like the people we serve
column4: we come from every walk of life. We are proud of our inclusive culture because when you create a workplace where all employees can thrive

column1: As part of the Bank of America team
column2: Client Solutions Specialist listen to our clients to understand which products and services are best suited for their unique needs while providing an exceptional client experience. Make a difference where it counts by joining our team at Bank of America. We’re seeking skilled sales professionals who can advise and advocate for our client’s most important financial needs. Specialists are sales professionals who work in a call center and understand that being there for our clients is our number one priority.  What would you like the power to do?

column1: • Competitive suite of benefits including tuition/dependent care reimbursement
•A schedule that works with your life.  We have several schedule offerings to help you achieve better work-life balance.  Ask one of our recruiters about our schedule options.
•Collaborating with a team of professional sales specialists and managers in a call center environment.

column2: dynamic environment and interacting with clients throughout your day

column1: • Communicating with clients throughout the entire shift with structured breaks.
• Navigating multiple computer systems while interacting with the client.

column2: understanding and providing needs-based sales solutions for our clients.

column1: • Incentive opportunities for meeting and/or exceeding critical performance standards.
• Long term career opportunity with multiple career development paths.
• Get training and on-the-job support from managers who are invested in your success. You’ll receive in-depth classroom training
column2: including side-by-side live call handling and continued on-the-job training and coaching.

column1: • Learn about core banking products and services we provide through Bank of America. Understand which products/services will work best for the client throughout the relationship and how to uncover their needs using best in class tools and resources.
• Provide education to clients. Inform and educate clients on products that are available and will benefit them to meet their needs.

column2: commitment and drive to deliver an experience that improves our clients’ financial lives

column1: • Has a commitment to teamwork and the flexibility to work the schedule
• Has the ability to engage with clients and seek to understand their needs while actively sharing options using plain language
• Is comfortable receiving ongoing performance feedback and coaching
• Enjoys ongoing change and learning new technology/processes
• One year of sales experience with cross-selling
• Has an intermediate level of proficiency with computers
• Is self-motivated with excellent organizational skills
• Has strong decision-making and problem-solving skills
You’ll be better prepared if you have (desired skills)
• Experience working in a call center
• Experience with multi-solution customer offerings and bundling services
• Experience working as a Personal Banker managing high client volume
• Is committed to building a workplace where every employee is welcomed and given the support and resources to build and advance their careers. Along with taking care of our clients
column2: we want to be a great place for people to work
column3: and we strive to create an environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve their goals.

column1: • Believes diversity makes us stronger so we can reflect
column2: connect to and meet the diverse needs of our clients around the world.

column1: • Provides continuous training and developmental opportunities to help employees achieve their goals
• Is committed to advancing our tools
column2: technology and ways of working. We always put our clients first to meet their evolving needs.

column1: • Believes in responsible growth and is dedicated to supporting communities around the world by connecting them to the lending
column2: investing and giving they need to remain vibrant and vital. Start Date: February 7

FL Full Time;Lead Design Researcher for XD Lab;"Job Description:

we’re guided by a common purpose: to help make financial lives better by connecting clients and communities to the resources they need to be successful. Bank of America’s Experience Design team includes a cross section of design and research disciplines focused on creating human-centered digital experiences that serve that common purpose.

column1: The XD Research and Innovation Lab has a charter to explore
column3: test and experiment against all aspects of the customer experience within the Bank of America ecosystem. From financial centers and ATMs
column5: emerging technologies and anything in between and beyond. The XD Research and Innovation Lab is embedded with the delivery teams to ensure high quality
column6: user-centered solutions while also identifying new opportunities to inform mid to long-range product planning.

column1: This position reports directly to the XD Lab Director. As a lead researcher
column2: you will be aligned to a digital product or portfolio and work closely with that design director. You’ll be expected to manage the research pipeline
column4: and play an advisor and strategic consultant empowering the designers with actionable insights that guide and inspire the solution space.

column1: It’s critical that you work with designers and product owners to understand the requirements or problem space and define the appropriate research approach. You’ll successfully manage your partner’s expectations and gain alignment on what to study and the desired outcomes of the research. At times
column2: you will manage other researchers to support multiple workstreams when the demands spike in your portfolio of work. As a lead researcher
column3: you’ll be expected to leverage a full stack of research methods to achieve generative or evaluative needs. You must demonstrate leadership and mastery in your craft; you’ll be accountable to coach team members working closely with you to raise research skillsets across the organization. You will Influence all XD designers
column5: and collaborators in the proper use of research methods to ensure quality
column7: and efficiency. As a lead researcher you’ll be expected to learn and become a subject matter expert in your product/portfolio domain and support the broader activities to benchmark and measure the digital ecosystem. Ultimately
column8: you must demonstrate leadership qualities to successfully influence your peers
column11: and the digital products you support.

column1: •              Work closely with cross-functional product and design teams to develop research plans that will effectively meet the bank’s business and design objectives.

column2: but is not limited to: usability studies
column8: diary studies and other longitudinal studies.

column3: and pursue research opportunities that will proactively assist the work of your product and design teams.

column1: •              Communicate and share your work at all times

column1: •              Learn and contribute to Bank of America’s customer persona framework and be able to identify and recruit customer participants that meet the requirements of each research study.
•              Contribute thought leadership across the XD Lab and drive strategic initiatives to raise the quality and consistency of research.
•              Provide quarterly research reports [to the XD Lab Director] which provide evidence of process rigor
You’re a person who has (required skills)
•              6+ years of well-rounded design strategy and research experience
•              An outstanding portfolio that exemplifies excellence in strategic thinking
•              Knowledge of both Agile and Waterfall design and development processes
•              Knowledge of best practices in user interface design and the ability to make research-based design recommendations
•              Experience in performing ethnographic research as well as moderating lab-based and remote qualitative and quantitative design and usability research activities
•              Expertise in the use of tools and techniques in qualitative and quantitative design research
•              Expertise in designing for a wide range of customer and product experiences
•              Expertise in Design Thinking and human-centered design

FL Full Time;Lead Design Researcher for XD Lab;"Job Description:

we’re guided by a common purpose: to help make financial lives better by connecting clients and communities to the resources they need to be successful. Bank of America’s Experience Design team includes a cross section of design and research disciplines focused on creating human-centered digital experiences that serve that common purpose.

column1: The XD Research and Innovation Lab has a charter to explore
column3: test and experiment against all aspects of the customer experience within the Bank of America ecosystem. From financial centers and ATMs
column5: emerging technologies and anything in between and beyond. The XD Research and Innovation Lab is embedded with the delivery teams to ensure high quality
column6: user-centered solutions while also identifying new opportunities to inform mid to long-range product planning.

column2: you will be aligned to a digital product or portfolio and work closely with that design director. You’ll be expected to manage the research pipeline
column4: and play an advisor and strategic consultant empowering the designers with actionable insights that guide and inspire the solution space.

column1: It’s critical that you work with designers and product owners to understand the requirements or problem space and define the appropriate research approach. You’ll successfully manage your partner’s expectations and gain alignment on areas of interest and exploration. At times
column2: you will manage other researchers to support multiple workstreams when the demands spike in your portfolio of work. As a lead researcher
column3: you’ll be expected to leverage a full stack of research methods to achieve generative or evaluative needs. You must demonstrate leadership and mastery in your craft; you’ll be accountable to coach team members working closely with you to raise research skillsets across the organization. You will Influence all XD designers
column5: and collaborators in the proper use of research methods to ensure quality
column7: and efficiency. As a lead researcher you’ll be expected to learn and become a subject matter expert in your product/portfolio domain and support the broader activities to benchmark and measure the digital ecosystem. Ultimately
column8: you must demonstrate leadership qualities to successfully influence your peers
column11: and the digital products you support.

column1: Work closely with cross-functional product and design teams to develop research programs and plans that will effectively meet the bank’s business and design objectives.
Conduct a variety of qualitative and quantitative research activities to provide the bank’s product and design teams with a more comprehensive understanding of the digital experience. This includes
column2: but is not limited to: usability studies
column8: diary studies and other longitudinal studies.

column3: and pursue research opportunities that will proactively assist the work of your product and design teams.

column1: Communicate and share your work at all times
column2: generating visual artifacts that make the research process and your findings digestible and easily understood beyond XD.

column1: Learn and contribute to Bank of America’s customer persona framework and be able to identify and recruit customer participants that meet the requirements of each research study.
Contribute thought leadership across the XD Lab and drive strategic initiatives to raise the quality and consistency of research.
Provide quarterly research reports [to the XD Lab Director] which provide evidence of process rigor
You’re a person who has (required skills)
6+ years of well-rounded design strategy and research experience
An outstanding portfolio that exemplifies excellence in strategic thinking
Knowledge of both Agile and Waterfall design and development processes
Knowledge of best practices in user interface design and the ability to make research-based design recommendations
Experience in performing ethnographic research as well as moderating lab-based and remote qualitative and quantitative design and usability research activities
Expertise in the use of tools and techniques in qualitative and quantitative design research
Expertise in designing for a wide range of customer and product experiences
Expertise in Design Thinking and human-centered design
column2: with strategic experience in persona development

column1: Expertise in planning and executing generative empathy research
column2: and in planning and facilitating workshops and design ideation sessions
business and technology value when designing research plans and presenting your findings

column1: Strong project and team leadership experience
column2: with a track record of inspiring teams to deliver in the face of internal and external challenges

column1: Analytical skills and the ability to communicate insights gleaned from generative and evaluative research data in a manner that generates actionable design concepts
Skill with identifying themes and opportunities for digital innovation through research
column2: and can build a data-driven case for change

column1: Possesses enthusiasm about experience design and research
column2: and is a highly motivated self-starter with a strong work ethic
remaining open to feedback and adapting quickly and positively to changes

column1: Maturity and self-awareness to nurture strong working relationships with colleagues
column2: whether co-located or in distributed teams

column1: Command of communication and collaboration skills to confidently lead cross-functional teams through research planning to execution and reporting
column2: and represent the work to all levels within the organization.
